title: How to Make Char Siu (Cha Shao)

text: Remove the skin from the pork belly  Use a tenderizer to tenderize the pork all over. Set aside. Grind the ginger and shallots, separate the juice out  Create a marinade. In a bowl, combine the ginger & shallot juice, the oyster sauce, light and dark soy sauce, hoisin sauce, the Rose Wine "Mui Fa Lo Chau", the cubes of Lam Yues (fermented bean curd), 1/4 cup honey, 5 spice, Cinnamon, . Mix until well blended. Marinate the pork in the refrigerator overnight.  Pre-heat the oven to 250 °C (482 °F). (If you have a grill set, use it) Lay the pork on a greased rack and spread foil on the bottom for easier cleaning.  Grill the pork for 5 minutes max on both sides (10 minutes total), take it out, glaze it with a mixture of 1/4 cup of honey mix with 1 tablespoon of dark soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon of light soy sauce. Put it back to the oven of grill set for another 10 minutes, take it out and glaze it again with the honey/dark soy sauce mixture, put it back again. Repeat this until 30 minutes max. Finished.
